09:28 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi. I built XE yesterday evening and didn't find any dup jars in WEB-INF/lib  
09:28 <vmassol> where do you see duplications?  
09:30 <vmassol> also why is enterprise web depending on watchlist api?  
09:31 <vmassol> (since watchlist is included in platform web)  
09:31 <vmassol> or is it not? (checking)  
09:35 <@sdumitriu> Hi vmassol  
09:35 <@sdumitriu> No, platform-web doesn't depend on most plugins  
09:36 <@sdumitriu> They are pulled by enterprise-web  
09:36 <@sdumitriu> Not sure if it's right or not  
09:36 <vmassol> in any case I don't see the issue and how dups could creep in  
09:37 <vmassol> ah yes because war is a blob  
09:37 <vmassol> got to go right now, bb in 30 mn  
09:38 <@sdumitriu> If you built everything locally, you won't get dups  
09:38 <@sdumitriu> If you build only enterprise-web and take a platform-web snapshot from maven.xwiki.org, you'll get dups  
09:38 <@sdumitriu> Since the builds from maven use timestamped jars

10:51 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the problem is maven's limitation with war (it sees it as a blog and doesn't handle dependencies transitively). Thus any module that goes in the platform war can also be referenced by some top level project and could be duplicated. We need to solve this generically since we cannot use "provided" deps everywhere in platform, especially since its not correct. I have the feeling that one solution is to remove the platform war dis  
10:51 <vmassol> s/top level modules/top level projects/  
10:52 <vmassol> this makes sense since we agree we don't have a notion of core  
10:52 <vmassol> s/agree/agreed/  
10:52 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: OK for me  
10:54 <vmassol> ok I'll make a proposal  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> So, platform-web becomes just a collection of files  
10:55 <vmassol> yes  
10:55 <vmassol> we can separate it in 2 as we had planned  
10:55 <vmassol> one for resources and one for templates  
10:55 <vmassol> (or we keep it as one)  
10:58 <arkub\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <arkub\_> has quit  
11:04 <vmassol> sent  
11:08 <lucaa> has quit  
11:14 <rousseau> has left #xwiki  
11:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <vmassol> cjdelisle: would be good if you could have a look at the mail vote  
11:25 <vmassol> s/mail vote/vote mail/  
11:26 <vmassol> then if we agree about it we need to decide when to implement it. I could do it this morning if we wanted. Should we do this before or after the 3.1M1 release which is getting very late already?  
11:26 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I would say after  
11:27 <vmassol> I'm fine with that, we need to release 3.1M1 asap  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> We need to stablize M1 before we can release unless you want to release with broken tests. There are a lit of tests which I have never seen testing code which I have not seen so it's going slowly for me and any help would be great.  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> Anyway I think that takes precident over the vote  
12:11 <vmassol> yes we need to fix the tests. We should all help.  
12:12 <vmassol> 55 failures! http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/lastBuild/testReport/  
12:13 <vmassol> cjdelisle: any idea why this happened: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-storage/572/testReport/org.xwiki.test.storage/AttachmentTest/testRollbackAfterSaveDeleteSaveAttachment/ ? flickering?  
12:14 <vmassol> is anca on holidays? checking  
12:14 <@cjdelisle> Yes, that is a flicher which I need to understand.  
12:14 <vmassol> this one seems to be caused by her changes: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/572/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageFromTemplate/  
12:15 <vmassol> (at least it could be caused by her changes)  
12:16 <vmassol> yes she's on holiday till tomorrow  
12:16 <vmassol> (included)  
12:16 <vmassol> lunch, bb just after and I'll start helping fixing the tests  
12:16 <@cjdelisle> I thought I had that one working. I was not happy that my change kept the integrity of the test but it all seemed to work from a user pPOV.  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: I'm not sure it's OK to fix the test  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> The behavior shouldn't change  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> It's not OK to warp the test around a buggy behavior  
12:20 <@sdumitriu> Anca said that in case something doesn't work, we should revert her commit, since it can wait for M2  
12:22 <@cjdelisle> Sounds good enough to me. I was not satisfied with the safety of the change, namely template was replaced with TemplateProvider in all of the handles.  
12:22 <@cjdelisle> \*element name/id  
12:25 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <@cjdelisle> sdumitriu: Are you working on reverting Anca's revisions?  
12:36 <@sdumitriu> No  
12:36 <@sdumitriu> Should I?  
12:38 <@cjdelisle> It would be great. 55 broken tests means it will take everyone a while. It would take me alone a year.  
12:39 <@sdumitriu> K, I'll do the revert  
12:41 <@sdumitriu> Done  
12:42 <@cjdelisle> great, thanks. It will be interesting to see how many tests that fixes (fingers crossed)  
12:42 <@sdumitriu> We'll see in about two hours  
12:42 <@sdumitriu> Tests take too much :(  
12:44 <@cjdelisle> http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/572/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui.scheduler/SchedulerTest/testSchedulerJobDefaultEditMode/  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> this has been passed off as a "nonrepeatable only happens in the CI you are all crazy" test.  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> That is not true, it is perfectly repeatable but only when all tests are run  
12:46 <vmassol> functional tests are not isolated so could it be a state issue?  
12:47 <@cjdelisle> very likely. I will debug after I am finished with the other UI tests, if someone wants to pick up selenium tests, that would be great.  
12:48 <vmassol> waiting for #574 on enterprise tests  
12:49 <vmassol> actually seems that the rollback is not in 7192  
12:49 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/changes  
12:50 <vmassol> sdumitriu: did you reopen the jira issue related to anca's commit?  
12:50 <@sdumitriu> No

12:51 <SvenDowideit\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <+tmortagne> there is something wrong in the Blog velocity code around $totalItems and $totalPages variable  
12:51 <+tmortagne> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/572/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_Blog\_\_page\_News\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
12:51 <+tmortagne> it's breaking several tests  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> running alltests and getting coffee...  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> bb

14:15 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Was there a tutorial about writing components in Groovy?  
14:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I don't think so but there are examples in the notification tutorial I think  
14:26 <vmassol> basically the only thing to know is the dynamic registration  
14:26 <vmassol> (against the CM)  
14:26 <vmassol> the rest is similar to component dev in java  
14:27 <vmassol> if you're looking for a real life example the IRC Bot app has examples  
14:27 <@sdumitriu> Ah, good idea  
14:28 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it's there  
14:28 <@sdumitriu> Utils.getComponentManager().registerComponent(descriptor)  
14:28 <@sdumitriu> Thanks  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> what is this?  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> By buttonLocator = By.xpath("//\*[@id='usersandgroupstable-display']//td[@class='username']/a[contains(@href, '" + entityName + "')]/../../td[" + right.getColumnIndex() + "]/img");  
14:40 <vmassol> a rights checkbox I think  
14:47 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <@cjdelisle> LiveTable.waitUntilReady does not necessarily work.  
14:48 <vmassol> ah… I tried to make it work always…. what did I forget?  
14:48 <vmassol> (I don't recall the code though would need to read it again)  
14:49 <@cjdelisle> All I know is that BreadCrumbTest fails unless I throw a 1 second sleep after the switch to user pane.  
14:49 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: same for me I could not make it work for watchlist test  
14:50 <+tmortagne> so I had to add a not so nice wait with a comment  
14:50 <@cjdelisle> something like this? try{Thread.sleep(1000);}catch(Exception ex){}  
14:50 <+tmortagne> not that bad no :)  
14:51 <@cjdelisle> that's my test code  
14:51 <vmassol> please don't commit any wait :)  
14:51 <@cjdelisle> and breakpoint  
14:51 <@cjdelisle> try{for(;;){Thread.sleep(1000);}}catch(Exception e){}  
14:51 <vmassol> we need to fix it properly  
14:51 <vmassol> maybe something changed recently in the livetable  
14:51 <@cjdelisle> when is the release?  
14:51 <vmassol> I don't recall this test failing before  
14:51 <vmassol> cjdelisle: last monday  
14:52 <@cjdelisle> no, last monday was the beginning of the stabilization period ;)  
14:52 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: i did https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/watchlist/WatchlistTest.java  
14:52 <vmassol> cjdelisle: nope, that was 5 days before last monday  
14:52 <vmassol> (what we give are release dates, not stabilization dates, so the RM has to plan ahead)  
14:52 <vmassol> (that was jerome ;))  
14:54 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'm fine to release with this special test failing if it passes manually and if we work on it after the release to fix it properly  
14:54 <vmassol> IMO it's acceptable for release reasons to bypass false positives but we need to work on them after the release  
14:55 <@cjdelisle> okay then I'll stop looking at breadcrumb test  
14:55 <vmassol> (should be the exception rather than the norm though ;))  
14:55 <@sdumitriu> We've always released with failing tests since a long time  
14:55 <@sdumitriu> Last 100% pass was a very long time ago  
14:55 <vmassol> (which is bad)  
14:55 <@sdumitriu> Yes it is  
14:56 <+tmortagne> it was usually flickering tests not test failing all the time  
14:56 <@cjdelisle> I can see the adventage of the Linux kernel method. You bring in your patches and if they are easy for Linus to merge then he does, otherwise your feature is not included.  
14:57 <@sdumitriu> Yep

16:51 <kutuzovas> is that possible?

17:46 <vmassol> cjdelisle: IMO you should fork the git repo to start a release branch  
17:46 <vmassol> then devs who want to help can clone your branch  
17:46 <vmassol> or you don't fork but just create a branch  
17:47 <vmassol> (clone)  
17:47 <@cjdelisle> I was planning on releasing right now from trunk.  
17:47 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <vmassol> s/clone//  
17:47 <@cjdelisle> Because I didn't see any "I will take BlahBlahSomethingTest and SomeOtherTest"  
17:47 <vmassol> cjdelisle: all tests are false positives?  
17:48 <@cjdelisle> All of the UI tests are. I have not looked at the selenium 1 tests.  
17:48 <mbryant> Hey guys question for you, I am trying to build the XWiki WYSIWSG through maven, and I am having some issue, and the documentation is fuzzy a best, is there anyone that can help me out?  
17:48 <@cjdelisle> There are 16 of them, How about I start at the top and you start at the bottom?  
17:49 <vmassol> cjdelisle: IMO it's supposed to be simple to create branches in git so you might as well start the correct process (ie allow devs to contiune committing on trunk)  
17:49 <vmassol> unelss that's a strategy to have all devs focus on the release  
17:49 <vmassol> which is a good point  
17:49 <vmassol> :)  
17:49 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:50 <@cjdelisle> I agree about branching for release but do you want to have a stabilization period for this release?  
17:50 <@cjdelisle> When exactly are you expecting the executable to be ready?  
17:51 <vmassol> asap but without impacting the release quality  
17:51 <@cjdelisle> hahaha good answer :)  
17:51 <vmassol> :)  
17:51 <@cjdelisle> Of course it will impact quality, the longer we work at it the better the quality.  
17:51 <vmassol> imo ensuring that all fialing tests are false positives is enough  
17:51 <@cjdelisle> How long do you expect that to take?  
17:52 <vmassol> dunno 36 failing tests, maybe 1 day max  
17:52 <vmassol> you already did a few  
17:52 <vmassol> so maybe 1/2 day from now on max  
17:52 <@cjdelisle> There are 16 selenium 1 tests and 16 webstandards tests.  
17:53 <vmassol> btw did hudson rebuilt the tests with the rollback?  
17:53 <@cjdelisle> http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/575/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/#showFailuresLink  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> Those 3 failing tests I can make pass repeatably as long as I run them in isolation. The tests themselves appear to be buggy.  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> \*I can make them fail repeatably by running all tests.  
17:54 <@cjdelisle> I am repoting that on jira  
17:54 <vmassol> cjdelisle: if you can reproduce then that's cool  
17:55 <vmassol> I can work on the SectionTest one if you tell me how to rperoduce  
17:55 <@cjdelisle> So are you proposing a fork of the tree today, stabilization tomorrow and release on monday?  
17:55 <@cjdelisle> \*today and tomorrow  
17:56 <vmassol> could be a good idea  
17:56 <vmassol> what do others think?  
17:56 <vmassol> note that I'm having an eye surgery tomorrow morning and I'll be off the morning as  a result  
17:57 <vmassol> (hopefully I'll be able to see better in the afternoon ;))  
17:57 <+tmortagne> -1 for fork, branch is enough  
17:57 <@cjdelisle> This is a hybred of #1 and #2 then  
17:58 <+tmortagne> most of webstandard test are failing because of bad velocity tests in blog  
17:58 <+tmortagne> i would not call that false positive even if it's a warning  
17:59 <+tmortagne> tests=if

18:02 <@cjdelisle> ok, writing

18:45 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Is there something special to do when registering components dynamically, w.r.t. their dependencies?  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> descriptor.setImplementation(StatsSS.class)  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> descriptor.setRole(ScriptService.class)  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> descriptor.setRoleHint("statistics")  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> descriptor.addComponentDependency(org.xwiki.context.Execution.class, 'default')  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> Utils.getComponentManager().registerComponent(descriptor)  
18:45 <@sdumitriu> But when I lookup my component, the Execution dependency is not injected  
18:47 <@cjdelisle> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleasePlans#HFixfailingtests
